intro: Hemigyrosa canescens var. cambodiana, commonly known as the Cambodian silverleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
